title: Michael Jackson's final days are being turned into a TV show - US TV
text: Michael Jackson's final days are to be the subject of a new TV show.Warner Bros has picked up the rights to an upcoming biography, which focuses on the last 16 weeks of the singer's life. © George De Sota/Redferns via Getty ImagesMichael Jackson Tavis Smiley's book Before You Judge Me… will be released in 2016, centring on the planning stages of Jackson's This Is It concerts.Warner Bros said in a statement that the biography will "examine the soaring highs and deep lows faced by the late popstar - his constant hunt for privacy in a life that was more public than almost any other, and the pressures he endured as someone whose fame made him socially fragile and almost unable to live".Jackson died on June 25, 2009 following a cardiac arrest. He had been due to start his run of 50 shows at The O2 in London 18 days later.This year, it was announced that the 'Thriller' star was in talks with George Lucas to play Jar Jar Binks in Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace, but he ultimately lost out to Ahmed Best.Watch the video for Michael Jackson's 'Billie Jean' below:
